description: A walk from St Pancras station to highlight the amazing new traffic-free piazza being created in the Strand. The walk will follow a Footways route https://footways.london/ along attractive,low pollution streets, and end at St Mary le Strand

designers.architect: Many, including Scott, Hodgkinson, Soane, Hardwick, Lutyens, Inigo Jones (attributed), Gibbs, Wren and Chambers

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The walk will explore the development of the area from the 17th to the 21st century, walking along streets with buildings of all these periods.

factsheet.heading: Public realm
paragraphs: Huge public realm improvements have been and are being made in Camden and Westminster. The walk takes you along streets free of through motor traffic. At Brunswick Square, a roundabout hss been turned into a pedestrian space. At the Strand, there will be events to celebrate the create of a superb new public space. Westminster officers will describe the design proposals

factsheet.heading: Architecture
paragraphs: The walk takes you past masterpieces by Scott, Hodgkinson, Soane, Lutyens, Inigo Jones (attributed), Gibbs and Chambers. At the end we will visit Gibbs' superb St Mary le Strand,

images.title: View along the Strand with proposed new piazza

location.address: Euston Road, NW1 2AR - near junction with Midland Road, NW1 2AR
location.meeting_point: Meet in front of entrance to St Pancras Renaissance Hotel
travel_info: Nearest tube: King's Cross St. Pancras
Nearest train: Euston, King's Cross, St.Pancras

name: London Living Streets and Footways London
